Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Short- versus Long-term Dual Antiplatelet Therapy for Stent-Assisted Coil Embolization of Cerebral Aneurysms

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicenter, open-label, parallel-group randomised controlled trial was conducted in 17 hospitals in Japan.

Participants.evidence: Patients aged â‰¥20 years, treated with SACE, and on DAPT were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to long-term (12 months) or short-term (3 months) DAPT with aspirin and clopidogrel.

Objective.evidence: This trial aimed to determine if long-term DAPT reduces ischemic stroke occurrence compared to short-term DAPT.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was time to ischemic stroke from 3 to 12 months post-SACE.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was web-based, with no blinding.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation was web-based, with no blinding.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From November 4, 2016, to January 7, 2019, 142 patients were randomised: 65 to long-term and 68 to short-term DAPT.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis included 65 in the long-term and 68 in the short-term group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Ischemic stroke occurred in 0 patients in the long-term group and 1 in the short-term group (0.0 vs 2.1/100 person-years; P=0.33).

Harms.evidence: Two hemorrhagic events occurred in the long-term group.

Funding.evidence: The trial was funded by Daiichi Sankyo Co., Ltd. Japan.
